alert.note: Alert for Martin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 26 at 2:23PM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following county, Martin. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 223 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stuart, Indiantown, Jupiter Island, Palm City, Port Salerno, Jensen Beach, Hobe Sound, Sewall`s Point, North River Shores, Witham Field, Ocean Breeze Park, Rio, Hobe Sound Wildlife Refuge, Hutchinson Island South and Port Mayaca. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
